message: This question comes up all the time. The simple answer is to Ask. Friends and family in real life, coworkers, anyone you can think of. Ask on HN, Twitter, and other communities even if you don't have a big following. If it's a great site it will probably pick up a little bit of buzz.

let me give a star to that

For example, Cranium released their addictive, higher priced board game not in Toys R Us where they'd be just another toy on the shelf, but in Starbucks where their customers hung out, had the disposable income to purchase the game, but most importantly, were in a fun/community/relaxed mindset that allowed customers to EXPERIENCE the game before they bought.

I think the "startup" marketing to other "startups" is a misnomer.  You have to first figure out who your target customer is that would use your site first.  If it's a day care site, then all the posts on HN won't do a bit of good.  After you figure out who your earliest target market adopters are, then you need to figure out where they hang out, both online and offline, but reach them in unique ways to cut through the noise.

they also gave the game for free to the employees of starbucks.  How did it happen? Leveraged their network to reach the CEO of Starbucks and he was looking for just the thing for his starbucks.  So, my question to you is, who are your target customers, and how can you reach them in a unique way to allow them to experience your product?
